item.title: Flat Rate vs Pay As You Go Conference Calling
item.description: You’ve already seen how conference calls and web conferencing can save your company a lot of money. So why worry about the small costs involved? Firstly, saving money is always a good thing. Secondly, the more affordable conference calls are, the more you can use them to boost productivity. Let’s examine AccuConference, a leading teleconferencing provider, and see their pricing options. AccuConference offers both flat rate and pay-as-you-go conference calls.

item.title: Vanity, Thy Number is Toll Free
item.description: Vanity definitely has a place in business. Any technology that provides a competitive advantage, including a vanity toll-free number, is worth considering. What distinguishes a vanity number from a regular toll-free number is the connection between letters and numbers on a standard telephone keypad. While the “1” button lacks letters, numbers “2” through “9” each have three letters assigned to them. This letter-number association allows phone numbers to be dialed as words.

item.title: Phone Toll-Free Service
item.description: In today’s competitive business landscape, making things easier for customers can give you a significant edge. Offering a toll-free number is a simple way to stand out, as it demonstrates value and eliminates a potential barrier for price-conscious customers. While the cost of a phone call may seem trivial, even small expenses can influence purchasing decisions, especially for budget-conscious businesses. Providing a toll-free number removes this obstacle and presents a customer-friendly image.

item.title: PRI vs POTS Telephone Service
item.description: Business telephone systems come in various sizes, from single-line setups to large enterprise systems with thousands of phones. This article aims to help you determine the right system size for your business needs. The most basic phone service is known as POTS, or Plain Old Telephone Service, although it’s often marketed as a business line or dial-tone service. This service provides an analog connection to the nearest telephone company’s Central Office (CO).
